H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5090.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other, whether with force or not

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1086.def: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H5362.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife, razor, or axe to remove part of a larger object

H7219.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8513.def: literally: weariness; hence: = something that causes humans to feel upset

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4285.def: = a place where there is little or no light, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H1443.def: = causative action by which someone builds or repairs a wall, often made of natural stones; ≈ such a wall is sometimes used to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H5178.def: = a reddish-brown metal, ◄ mined from the hills, ► and used, together with {L:tin<SDBH:בְּדִיל>}, for the production of bronze

12.gl: to weigh down with chains > to bring heavy suffering

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H1443.def: = causative action by which someone builds or repairs a wall, often made of natural stones; ≈ such a wall is sometimes used to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1496.def: = large stone that was cut square ► so that it could be laid on other stones to form a wall or building; ≈ associated with wealth and heaviness

H5753.def: = causative action by which deities change the shape of an object ► with the purpose of destroying it

H1677.def: = large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H4565.def: = a place where humans or animals go in order to not be readily seen by others, ► either to keep safe from danger or to attack others

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8076.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H4307.def: = elite group of soldiers, ► responsible for protecting buildings and high-ranking officials

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H827.def: = long, narrow container ► for storing one's arrows

H7814.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H5058.def: = musical instrument with strings, such as a {L:lute<SDBH:כִּנֹּור>} or {L:lyre<SDBH:נֵבֶל>}

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H4844.def: = bitter-tasting herbs, ► eaten as part of the {L:Passover<SDBH:פֶּסַח>} meal; ≈ associated with sadness and hardship

H3939.def: = a plant which may grow as large as a bush, with woolly green leaves, ◄ Artemisia herba-alba; ► the juice tastes bitter and can be poisonous; used as medicine; ≈ associated with injustice and suffering

H1638.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be slowly reduced by friction

H2687.def: = coarse sand or little stones; ≈ associated with low status; also sometimes found in food and therefore denoting an unexpected negative experience

H3728.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = causative action by which deities cause humans to lie down; ≈ associated with grief, humiliation, and suffering

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2186.def: = process by which an object acquires characteristics that are considered unacceptable

H5382.def: = action when one is no longer able to remember or recall a person or a past experience

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H8431.def: literally: waiting; hence: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H4788.def: literally: restlessness; hence: = state in which humans are experiencing hard times in which it is hard to feel at rest

H3939.def: = a plant which may grow as large as a bush, with woolly green leaves, ◄ Artemisia herba-alba; ► the juice tastes bitter and can be poisonous; used as medicine; ≈ associated with injustice and suffering

H7219.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8552.def: = process by which events reach the stage of completion

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H2319.def: = state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H615.def: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H5791.def: = process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

H6586.def: = action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H6051.def: = a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

glosses: wrong (committed by one human to another)
H5792.def: = action by which someone acts towards someone else in a morally or ethically unacceptable manner

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

6.gl: wrong (committed by one human to another)

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5360.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H1902.def: = action by which humans speaks softly for themselves as if thinking out loud

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7012.def: = action by which a human being gets up from a sitting or lying position

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H4485.def: = a {L:song<SDBH:שִׁיר>}, ► written and sung to make fun of someone else

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1576.def: = action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4044.def: meaning unsure, possibly: = state in which humans are unwilling or unable to think about something

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H8381.def: = action by which someone invokes the name of a deity and ask him to punish a wrong-doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases  where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so; ► the effectiveness of the curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H8045.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
